# Load necessary libraries

library(dismo)

# Load environmental data (stack of raster layers)

# Load species occurrence data
species <- read.csv("species_occurrence.csv")

# Fit a MaxEnt model
maxent_model <- maxent(env, species)

# Predict species distribution
prediction <- predict(maxent_model, env)

# Plot the prediction
plot(prediction)

heading: 3.3 Coordinate Reference Systems (CRS)
text: coordinate reference system (CRS) defines spatial data relates locations Earth. ensures spatial layers align correctly mapped analyzed.

heading: 3.3.1 Types of CRS
text: Geographic CRS: Uses latitude longitude (e.g., WGS84).Projected CRS: Converts Earth‚Äôs 3D surface flat 2D plane, often used detailed regional analyses (e.g., UTM, Albers Equal Area).

heading: 3.3.2 Example: Reprojecting Data in R
text: Best Practice: Always ensure spatial layers use CRS analysis.
code:
# Reprojecting vector data
reprojected_vector <- spTransform(vector_data, CRS("+proj=utm +zone=33 +datum=WGS84"))

# Reprojecting raster data
reprojected_raster <- projectRaster(raster_data, crs = CRS("+proj=utm +zone=33 +datum=WGS84"))
